title: Yusvinsky District
data: Yusvinsky District (Russian: Ю́сьвинский райо́н) is an administrative district (raion) of Komi-Permyak Okrug of Perm Krai, Russia; one of the thirty-three in the krai.[1] Municipally, it is incorporated as Yusvinsky Municipal District.[4] It is located in the center of the krai. The area of the district is 3,100 square kilometers (1,200 sq mi).[2] Its administrative center is the rural locality (a selo) of Yusva.[1] Population:  19,558 (2010 Census);[3] 23,724 (2002 Census);[6] 28,677 (1989 Soviet census).[7] The population of Yusva accounts for 23.9% of the district's total population.[3] About 70% of the district's territory is covered by forests.[2] The district was established on February 25, 1925.[2] Ethnic composition (as of the 2002 Census):[2] The economy of the district is based on agriculture and forestry.
